intro: Psychotria lepidocarpa, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria lepidocarpa is also known for containing various alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
